class LLaDABlock(torch.nn.modules.module.Module): 
530class LLaDABlock(nn.Module):
531    """
532    A base class for transformer block implementations.
533    """
534
535    def __init__(self, layer_id: int, config: ModelConfig, cache: BufferCache):
536        super().__init__()
537        self.layer_id = layer_id
538        self.config = config
539        self.hidden_size = config.mlp_hidden_size if config.mlp_hidden_size is not None else config.mlp_ratio * config.d_model
540        self.__cache = cache
541        assert config.d_model % config.n_heads == 0
542
543        self._activation_checkpoint_fn = None
544
545        # Dropout.
546        self.dropout = Dropout(config.residual_dropout)
547
548        # Layer norms.
549        self.k_norm: Optional[LayerNormBase] = None
550        self.q_norm: Optional[LayerNormBase] = None
551        if config.attention_layer_norm:
552            self.k_norm = LayerNormBase.build(
553                config,
554                size=(config.d_model // config.n_heads) * config.effective_n_kv_heads,
555                elementwise_affine=config.attention_layer_norm_with_affine,
556            )
557            self.q_norm = LayerNormBase.build(config, elementwise_affine=config.attention_layer_norm_with_affine)
558
559        # Activation function.
560        self.act = Activation.build(config)
561        assert (self.act.output_multiplier * self.hidden_size) % 1 == 0
562
563        # Attention output projection.
564        self.attn_out = nn.Linear(config.d_model, config.d_model, bias=config.include_bias, device=config.init_device)
565
566        # Feed-forward output projection.
567        self.ff_out = nn.Linear(
568            int(self.act.output_multiplier * self.hidden_size),
569            config.d_model,
570            bias=config.include_bias,
571            device=config.init_device,
572        )
573        self.ff_out._is_residual = True  # type: ignore
574
575        # Rotary embeddings.
576        if self.config.rope:
577            self.rotary_emb = RotaryEmbedding(config, self.__cache)
578
579        self.flash_attn_func = None
580        if config.flash_attention:
581            try:
582                from flash_attn import flash_attn_func  # type: ignore
583
584                self.flash_attn_func = flash_attn_func
585            except ModuleNotFoundError:
586                pass
587
588    def reset_parameters(self):
589        if self.k_norm is not None:
590            self.k_norm.reset_parameters()
591        if self.q_norm is not None:
592            self.q_norm.reset_parameters()
593        init_weights(
594            self.config,
595            self.attn_out,
596            d=self.config.d_model,
597            layer_id=self.layer_id,
598            type_of_module=ModuleType.out_module,
599        )
600        init_weights(
601            self.config,
602            self.ff_out,
603            d=self.ff_out.in_features,
604            layer_id=self.layer_id,
605            type_of_module=ModuleType.out_module,
606        )
607
608    def set_activation_checkpointing(self, strategy: Optional[ActivationCheckpointingStrategy]):
609        if strategy == ActivationCheckpointingStrategy.fine_grained:
610            self._activation_checkpoint_fn = activation_checkpoint_function(self.config)
611        else:
612            self._activation_checkpoint_fn = None
613
614    @classmethod
615    def _cast_attn_bias(cls, bias: torch.Tensor, input_dtype: torch.dtype) -> torch.Tensor:
616        target_dtype = input_dtype
617        # NOTE: `is_autocast_enabled()` only checks for CUDA autocast, so we use the separate function
618        # `is_autocast_cpu_enabled()` for CPU autocast.
619        # See https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/110966.
620        if torch.is_autocast_enabled():
621            target_dtype = torch.get_autocast_dtype(device.type)
622        if bias.dtype != target_dtype:
623            bias = bias.to(target_dtype)
624            ensure_finite_(bias, check_neg_inf=True, check_pos_inf=False)
625        return bias
626
627    def _scaled_dot_product_attention(
628        self,
629        q: torch.Tensor,
630        k: torch.Tensor,
631        v: torch.Tensor,
632        attn_mask: Optional[torch.Tensor] = None,
633        dropout_p: float = 0.0,
634        is_causal: bool = False,
635    ) -> torch.Tensor:
636        """
637        Computes scaled dot product attention on query, key and value tensors, using an optional
638        attention mask if passed, and applying dropout if a probability greater than 0.0 is specified.
639        """
640        if self.flash_attn_func is not None and attn_mask is None:
641            r = self.flash_attn_func(q.transpose(1, 2), k.transpose(1, 2), v.transpose(1, 2), dropout_p=dropout_p, causal=False)
642            return r.transpose(1, 2)
643        else:
644            # torch's sdpa doesn't support GQA, so we're doing this
645            assert k.size(1) == v.size(1)
646            num_kv_heads = k.size(1)
647            num_q_heads = q.size(1)
648            if num_q_heads != num_kv_heads:
649                assert num_q_heads % num_kv_heads == 0
650                k = k.repeat_interleave(num_q_heads // num_kv_heads, dim=1, output_size=num_q_heads)
651                v = v.repeat_interleave(num_q_heads // num_kv_heads, dim=1, output_size=num_q_heads)
652
653            # Modify: MDM set causal to False, and with no attn_mask.
654            return F.scaled_dot_product_attention(
655                q,
656                k,
657                v,
658                attn_mask=attn_mask,
659                dropout_p=dropout_p,
660                is_causal=False,
661            )
662
663    def attention(
664        self,
665        q: torch.Tensor,
666        k: torch.Tensor,
667        v: torch.Tensor,
668        attention_bias: Optional[torch.Tensor] = None,
669        layer_past: Optional[Tuple[torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor]] = None,
670        use_cache: bool = False,
671    ) -> Tuple[torch.Tensor, Optional[Tuple[torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor]]]:
672        B, T, C = q.size()  # batch size, sequence length, d_model
673        dtype = k.dtype
674
675        # Optionally apply layer norm to keys and queries.
676        if self.q_norm is not None and self.k_norm is not None:
677            q = self.q_norm(q).to(dtype=dtype)
678            k = self.k_norm(k).to(dtype=dtype)
679
680        # Move head forward to be next to the batch dim.
681        # shape: (B, nh, T, hs)
682        q = q.view(B, T, self.config.n_heads, C // self.config.n_heads).transpose(1, 2)
683        # shape: (B, n_kv_h, T, hs)
684        k = k.view(B, T, self.config.effective_n_kv_heads, C // self.config.n_heads).transpose(1, 2)
685        # shape: (B, n_kv_h, T, hs)
686        v = v.view(B, T, self.config.effective_n_kv_heads, C // self.config.n_heads).transpose(1, 2)
687
688        if layer_past is not None:
689            past_key, past_value = layer_past
690            k = torch.cat((past_key, k), dim=-2)
691            v = torch.cat((past_value, v), dim=-2)
692
693        present = (k, v) if use_cache else None
694        query_len, key_len = q.shape[-2], k.shape[-2]  # could be different if layer_past not None
695
696        if self.config.rope:
697            # Apply rotary embeddings.
698            q, k = self.rotary_emb(q, k)
699
700        if attention_bias is not None:
701            # Resize and cast attention bias.
702            # The current dtype of the attention bias might not match the dtype that the SDP attn function will
703            # run in if AMP is enabled, and this can be a problem if some tokens are masked out due to padding
704            # as down-casting the attention bias to the autocast precision will result in -infs, which will
705            # cause the SDP attn function to produce NaNs.
706            attention_bias = self._cast_attn_bias(attention_bias[:, :, key_len - query_len : key_len, :key_len], dtype)
707
708        # Get the attention scores.
709        # shape: (B, nh, T, hs)
710        att = self._scaled_dot_product_attention(
711            q,
712            k,
713            v,
714            attn_mask=attention_bias,
715            dropout_p=0.0 if not self.training else self.config.attention_dropout,
716            is_causal=False,
717        )
718
719        # Re-assemble all head outputs side-by-side.
720        att = att.transpose(1, 2).contiguous().view(B, T, C)
721
722        # Apply output projection.
723        return self.attn_out(att), present
724
725    @abstractmethod
726    def forward(
727        self,
728        x: torch.Tensor,
729        attention_bias: Optional[torch.FloatTensor] = None,
730        layer_past: Optional[Tuple[torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor]] = None,
731        use_cache: bool = False,
732    ) -> Tuple[torch.Tensor, Optional[Tuple[torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor]]]:
733        raise NotImplementedError
734
735    @classmethod
736    def build(cls, layer_id: int, config: ModelConfig, cache: BufferCache) -> LLaDABlock:
737        if config.block_type == BlockType.sequential:
738            return LLaDASequentialBlock(layer_id, config, cache)
739        elif config.block_type == BlockType.llama:
740            return LLaDALlamaBlock(layer_id, config, cache)
741        else:
742            raise NotImplementedError(f"Unknown block type: '{config.block_type}'")

A base class for transformer block implementations.

@abstractmethod
def forward( self, x: torch.Tensor, attention_bias: Optional[torch.FloatTensor] = None, layer_past: Optional[Tuple[torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor]] = None, use_cache: bool = False) -> Tuple[torch.Tensor, Optional[Tuple[torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor]]]: 
725    @abstractmethod

727        self,
728        x: torch.Tensor,
729        attention_bias: Optional[torch.FloatTensor] = None,
730        layer_past: Optional[Tuple[torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor]] = None,

732    ) -> Tuple[torch.Tensor, Optional[Tuple[torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor]]]:
733        raise NotImplementedError

Define the computation performed at every call.

Should be overridden by all subclasses.

Although the recipe for forward pass needs to be defined within this function, one should call the Module instance afterwards instead of this since the former takes care of running the registered hooks while the latter silently ignores them.

@classmethod
def build( cls, layer_id: int, config: divisor.mmada.configuration_llada.ModelConfig, cache: divisor.mmada.modeling_llada.BufferCache) -> LLaDABlock: 
735    @classmethod
736    def build(cls, layer_id: int, config: ModelConfig, cache: BufferCache) -> LLaDABlock:
737        if config.block_type == BlockType.sequential:
738            return LLaDASequentialBlock(layer_id, config, cache)
739        elif config.block_type == BlockType.llama:
740            return LLaDALlamaBlock(layer_id, config, cache)
741        else:
742            raise NotImplementedError(f"Unknown block type: '{config.block_type}'")
class LLaDASequentialBlock(LLaDABlock): 
745class LLaDASequentialBlock(LLaDABlock):
746    """
747    This is a typical transformer block where the output is computed as ``MLP(LN(x + Attention(LN(x))))``
748    (plus another skip connection).
749    """
750
751    def __init__(self, layer_id: int, config: ModelConfig, cache: BufferCache):
752        super().__init__(layer_id, config, cache)
753        # Layer norms.
754        self.attn_norm = LayerNorm.build(config)
755        self.ff_norm = LayerNorm.build(config)
756        # Attention input projection. Projects x -> (q, k, v)
757        head_dim = config.d_model // config.n_heads
758        self.fused_dims = (
759            config.d_model,
760            config.effective_n_kv_heads * head_dim,
761            config.effective_n_kv_heads * head_dim,
762        )
763        self.att_proj = nn.Linear(config.d_model, sum(self.fused_dims), bias=config.include_bias | config.include_qkv_bias, device=config.init_device)
764        # Feed-forward input projection.
765        self.ff_proj = nn.Linear(config.d_model, self.hidden_size, bias=config.include_bias, device=config.init_device)
766
767    def reset_parameters(self):
768        super().reset_parameters()
769        self.attn_norm.reset_parameters()
770        self.ff_norm.reset_parameters()
771        # NOTE: the standard deviation for these weights does not depend on the layer.
772        init_weights(self.config, self.att_proj, d=self.config.d_model, layer_id=None, type_of_module=ModuleType.in_module)
773        init_weights(self.config, self.ff_proj, d=self.config.d_model, layer_id=None, type_of_module=ModuleType.in_module)
774
775    def forward(
776        self,
777        x: torch.Tensor,
778        attention_bias: Optional[torch.Tensor] = None,
779        layer_past: Optional[Tuple[torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor]] = None,
780        use_cache: bool = False,
781    ) -> Tuple[torch.Tensor, Optional[Tuple[torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor]]]:
782        # Get query, key, value projections.
783        # shape:
784        #  - for regular attn q, k, v: (batch_size, seq_len, d_model)
785        #  - for multi-query attn q: (batch_size, seq_len, d_model)
786        #                      k, v: (batch_size, seq_len, d_model // n_heads)
787        #  - for group query attn q: (batch_size, seq_len, d_model)
788        #                      k, v: (batch_size, seq_len, d_model // n_kv_heads)
789        if self._activation_checkpoint_fn is not None:
790            q, k, v = self.att_proj(self._activation_checkpoint_fn(self.attn_norm, x)).split(self.fused_dims, dim=-1)
791        else:
792            q, k, v = self.att_proj(self.attn_norm(x)).split(self.fused_dims, dim=-1)
793
794        # Get attention scores.
795        if self._activation_checkpoint_fn is not None:
796            att, cache = self._activation_checkpoint_fn(  # type: ignore
797                self.attention, q, k, v, attention_bias, layer_past=layer_past, use_cache=use_cache
798            )
799        else:
800            att, cache = self.attention(q, k, v, attention_bias, layer_past=layer_past, use_cache=use_cache)
801
802        # Add attention scores.
803        # shape: (B, T, C)
804        x = x + self.dropout(att)
805
806        # Add feed-forward projection.
807        # shape: (batch_size, seq_len, d_model)
808        og_x = x
809        if self._activation_checkpoint_fn is not None:
810            x = self._activation_checkpoint_fn(self.ff_norm, x)  # type: ignore
811        else:
812            x = self.ff_norm(x)
813        x = self.ff_proj(x)
814        if self._activation_checkpoint_fn is not None:
815            x = self._activation_checkpoint_fn(self.act, x)  # type: ignore
816        else:
817            x = self.act(x)
818        x = self.ff_out(x)
819        x = self.dropout(x)
820        x = og_x + x
821
822        return x, cache

This is a typical transformer block where the output is computed as MLP(LN(x + Attention(LN(x)))) (plus another skip connection).

787        #  - for group query attn q: (batch_size, seq_len, d_model)

791        else:

793
794        # Get attention scores.

796            att, cache = self._activation_checkpoint_fn(  # type: ignore
797                self.attention, q, k, v, attention_bias, layer_past=layer_past, use_cache=use_cache
798            )
799        else:
800            att, cache = self.attention(q, k, v, attention_bias, layer_past=layer_past, use_cache=use_cache)
801
802        # Add attention scores.
803        # shape: (B, T, C)
804        x = x + self.dropout(att)
805
806        # Add feed-forward projection.
807        # shape: (batch_size, seq_len, d_model)
808        og_x = x
809        if self._activation_checkpoint_fn is not None:
810            x = self._activation_checkpoint_fn(self.ff_norm, x)  # type: ignore
811        else:
812            x = self.ff_norm(x)
813        x = self.ff_proj(x)
814        if self._activation_checkpoint_fn is not None:
815            x = self._activation_checkpoint_fn(self.act, x)  # type: ignore
816        else:
817            x = self.act(x)
818        x = self.ff_out(x)
819        x = self.dropout(x)
820        x = og_x + x
821
822        return x, cache

Define the computation performed at every call.

Should be overridden by all subclasses.

Although the recipe for forward pass needs to be defined within this function, one should call the Module instance afterwards instead of this since the former takes care of running the registered hooks while the latter silently ignores them.

1062            self.get_alibi_attention_bias(config.max_sequence_length, _non_meta_init_device(config))

1081    def reset_parameters(self):
1082        log.info("Initializing model parameters...")
1083        # Top-level embeddings / linear layers.
1084        init_weights(
1085            self.config,
1086            self.transformer.wte,  # type: ignore
1087            std_factor=(0.5 * math.sqrt(self.config.d_model)) if self.config.scale_logits else 1.0,
1088            type_of_module=ModuleType.emb,
1089        )
1090        if hasattr(self.transformer, "wpe"):
1091            init_weights(self.config, self.transformer.wpe, type_of_module=ModuleType.emb)  # type: ignore
1092
1093        # Top-level layer norm.
1094        self.transformer.ln_f.reset_parameters()  # type: ignore
1095
1096        # Output weights.
1097        if hasattr(self.transformer, "ff_out"):
1098            init_weights(self.config, self.transformer.ff_out, type_of_module=ModuleType.final_out)  # type: ignore
1099
1100        # Let the blocks handle themselves.
1101        if self.config.block_group_size == 1:
1102            for block in self.transformer.blocks:
1103                block.reset_parameters()
1104        else:
1105            for block_group in self.transformer.block_groups:
1106                block_group.reset_parameters()

1108    def get_alibi_attention_bias(self, seq_len: int, device: torch.device) -> torch.Tensor:
1109        if (alibi_bias := self.__cache.get("alibi_attention_bias")) is not None and alibi_bias.shape[-1] >= seq_len:
1110            if alibi_bias.device != device:
1111                alibi_bias = alibi_bias.to(device)
1112                self.__cache["alibi_attention_bias"] = alibi_bias
1113            return alibi_bias
1114        context = get_autocast_context(device)
1115        with context:
1116            alibi_bias = alibi_attention_bias(seq_len, self.config, device)
1117        self.__cache["alibi_attention_bias"] = alibi_bias
1118        return alibi_bias

1120    def forward(
1121        self,
1122        input_ids: torch.LongTensor,
1123        input_embeddings: Optional[torch.FloatTensor] = None,
1124        attention_mask: Optional[torch.Tensor] = None,
1125        attention_bias: Optional[torch.Tensor] = None,
1126        past_key_values: Optional[Sequence[Tuple[torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor]]] = None,
1127        use_cache: bool = False,
1128        last_logits_only: bool = False,
1129        output_hidden_states: Optional[bool] = None,
1130    ) -> LLaDAOutput:
1131        """
1132        :param input_ids: A tensor of shape `(batch_size, seq_len)`.
1133        :param input_embeddings: A tensor of shape `(batch_size, seq_len, d_model)` with input
1134            embeddings. When provided, it is treated as the output of the input embedding layer.
1135        :param attention_mask: A tensor of shape `(batch_size, seq_len)` that indicates
1136            which input IDs are masked. A `1` value in the mask means that
1137            the corresponding input ID should *not* be ignored. A `0` means
1138            that the corresponding input ID is masked.
1139
1140            This has the same meaning as the `attention_mask` in HuggingFace's `transformers`
1141            library.
1142        :param attention_bias: A tensor of shape `(batch_size, 1, seq_len, seq_len)`,
1143            `(1, 1, seq_len, seq_len)`, or `(seq_len, seq_len)`. This is used
1144            to introduce causal or other biases.
1145
1146            If the tensor is a bool or byte tensor, a `True` or `1` at `attention_bias[:, :, i, j]`
1147            indicates that the i-th element in the sequence is allowed to attend to the j-th
1148            element in the sequence.
1149
1150            If the tensor is a float tensor, it will just be added to the attention
1151            scores before the softmax.
1152
1153            The default is causal, which corresponds to a lower-diagonal byte matrix of ones.
1154        :param past_key_values: Pre-computed keys and values for each attention block.
1155            Can be used to speed up sequential decoding. The `input_ids` which have
1156            their past given to this model should not be passed as `input_ids` as they have already been computed.
1157        :param use_cache: If `True`, return key and value tensors for each block.
1158        :param last_logits_only: If `True`, only compute the logits for the last token of each sequence.
1159            This can speed up decoding when you only care about the next token.
1160        """
1161        # Add Basic MDM Model config check
1162        assert not self.config.alibi, "Alibi length extrapolation is not supported for MDM."
1163        assert self.config.rope, "Rope must be used in Llama-Encoder for MDM."
1164        assert past_key_values is None and not use_cache, "The kvcache is not suppotred for MDM."
1165
1166        output_hidden_states = output_hidden_states if output_hidden_states is not None else False
1167
1168        if past_key_values:
1169            assert len(past_key_values) == self.config.n_layers
1170
1171        batch_size, seq_len = input_ids.size() if input_embeddings is None else input_embeddings.size()[:2]
1172        if past_key_values is None:
1173            past_length = 0
1174        else:
1175            past_length = past_key_values[0][0].size(-2)
1176
1177        # Get embeddings of input.
1178        # shape: (batch_size, seq_len, d_model)
1179        # print(f"input_ids: {input_ids}, input_ids.shape: {input_ids.shape}")
1180        # print(f"transformer wte weight shape: {self.transformer.wte.weight.shape}")
1181        x = self.transformer.wte(input_ids) if input_embeddings is None else input_embeddings  # type: ignore
1182
1183        # print(f"xshape: {x.shape}")
1184
1185        if self.config.input_emb_norm:
1186            x = x * (self.config.d_model**0.5)
1187
1188        if not (self.config.alibi or self.config.rope):
1189            # Get positional embeddings.
1190            # shape: (1, seq_len)
1191            pos = torch.arange(past_length, past_length + seq_len, dtype=torch.long, device=x.device).unsqueeze(0)
1192            # shape: (1, seq_len, d_model)
1193            pos_emb = self.transformer.wpe(pos)  # type: ignore
1194            x = pos_emb + x
1195
1196        # Add input + positional embeddings and apply dropout.
1197        # shape: (batch_size, seq_len, d_model)
1198        x = self.transformer.emb_drop(x)  # type: ignore
1199
1200        # Transform the attention mask into what the blocks expect.
1201        if attention_mask is not None and 0.0 in attention_mask:
1202            # shape: (batch_size, 1, 1, seq_len)
1203            attention_mask = attention_mask.to(dtype=torch.float).view(batch_size, -1)[:, None, None, :]
1204            attention_mask = (1.0 - attention_mask) * torch.finfo(attention_mask.dtype).min
1205        else:
1206            attention_mask = None
1207
1208        # Merge attention mask with attention bias.
1209        if (
1210            attention_bias is not None
1211            or attention_mask is not None
1212            or self.config.alibi
1213            # NOTE (epwalsh): we need to initialize the attn bias in order for attn to work properly
1214            # with key+value cache. Otherwise `F.scaled_dot_product_attention()` doesn't seem to compute
1215            # scores correctly.
1216            or past_key_values is not None
1217        ):
1218            if attention_bias is None and self.config.alibi:
1219                # print(f"get_causal_attention_bias")
1220                attention_bias = get_causal_attention_bias(self.__cache, past_length + seq_len, x.device) + self.get_alibi_attention_bias(past_length + seq_len, x.device)
1221            elif attention_bias is None:
1222                # print(f"get_causal_attention_bias")
1223                attention_bias = get_causal_attention_bias(self.__cache, past_length + seq_len, x.device)
1224            elif attention_bias.dtype in (torch.int8, torch.bool):
1225                # print(f"attention_bias.dtype in (torch.int8, torch.bool)")
1226                attention_bias = attention_bias.to(dtype=torch.float)
1227                attention_bias.masked_fill_(attention_bias == 0.0, torch.finfo(attention_bias.dtype).min)
1228
1229            # Transform to the right shape and data type.
1230            mask_len = seq_len
1231            if attention_mask is not None:
1232                mask_len = attention_mask.shape[-1]
1233            elif past_key_values is not None:
1234                mask_len = past_key_values[0][0].shape[-2] + seq_len
1235            attention_bias = attention_bias[:, :, :mask_len, :mask_len].to(dtype=torch.float)
1236
1237            # Add in the masking bias.
1238            if attention_mask is not None:
1239                attention_bias = attention_bias + attention_mask
1240                # Might get -infs after adding attention mask, since dtype.min + dtype.min = -inf.
1241                # `F.scaled_dot_product_attention()` doesn't handle -inf like you'd expect, instead
1242                # it can produce NaNs.
1243                ensure_finite_(attention_bias, check_neg_inf=True, check_pos_inf=False)
1244
1245        attn_key_values: Optional[List[Tuple[torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor]]] = [] if use_cache else None
1246
1247        # decoder layers
1248        all_hidden_states = []
1249
1250        # Apply blocks one-by-one.
1251        if self.config.block_group_size == 1:
1252            for block_idx, block in enumerate(self.transformer.blocks):
1253                if output_hidden_states:
1254                    # add hidden states
1255                    all_hidden_states.append(x)
1256
1257                layer_past = None if past_key_values is None else past_key_values[block_idx]
1258                if (
1259                    (self.activation_checkpointing_strategy == ActivationCheckpointingStrategy.whole_layer)
1260                    or (self.activation_checkpointing_strategy == ActivationCheckpointingStrategy.one_in_two and block_idx % 2 == 0)
1261                    or (self.activation_checkpointing_strategy == ActivationCheckpointingStrategy.one_in_three and block_idx % 3 == 0)
1262                    or (self.activation_checkpointing_strategy == ActivationCheckpointingStrategy.one_in_four and block_idx % 4 == 0)
1263                ):
1264                    # shape: (batch_size, seq_len, d_model)
1265                    x, cache = self._activation_checkpoint_fn(block, x, attention_bias=attention_bias, layer_past=layer_past, use_cache=use_cache)
1266                else:
1267                    # shape: (batch_size, seq_len, d_model)
1268                    x, cache = block(x, attention_bias=attention_bias, layer_past=layer_past, use_cache=use_cache)
1269                if attn_key_values is not None:
1270                    assert cache is not None
1271                    attn_key_values.append(cache)
1272        else:
1273            for group_idx, block_group in enumerate(self.transformer.block_groups):
1274                if output_hidden_states:
1275                    # add hidden states
1276                    all_hidden_states.append(x)
1277
1278                layers_past = None if past_key_values is None else past_key_values[group_idx * self.config.block_group_size : (group_idx + 1) * self.config.block_group_size]
1279                x, cache = block_group(x, attention_bias=attention_bias, layers_past=layers_past, use_cache=use_cache)
1280                if attn_key_values is not None:
1281                    assert cache is not None
1282                    attn_key_values.extend(cache)
1283
1284        if last_logits_only:
1285            # shape: (batch_size, 1, d_model)
1286            x = x[:, -1, :].unsqueeze(1)
1287
1288        # Apply final layer norm.
1289        # shape: (batch_size, seq_len or 1, d_model)
1290        x = self.transformer.ln_f(x)  # type: ignore
1291        if output_hidden_states:
1292            # add final hidden state post-final-layernorm, following HuggingFace's convention
1293            all_hidden_states.append(x)
1294
1295        # Get logits.
1296        # shape: (batch_size, seq_len or 1, vocab_size)
1297        if self.config.weight_tying:
1298            logits = F.linear(x, self.transformer.wte.weight, None)  # type: ignore
1299        else:
1300            logits = self.transformer.ff_out(x)  # type: ignore
1301        if self.config.scale_logits:
1302            logits.mul_(1 / math.sqrt(self.config.d_model))
1303
1304        return LLaDAOutput(logits=logits, attn_key_values=attn_key_values, hidden_states=tuple(all_hidden_states) if output_hidden_states else None)  # type: ignore[arg-type]

Base class for all neural network modules.

Your models should also subclass this class.

Modules can also contain other Modules, allowing them to be nested in a tree structure. You can assign the submodules as regular attributes::

import torch.nn as nn
import torch.nn.functional as F


class Model(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self) -> None:
        super().__init__()
        self.conv1 = nn.Conv2d(1, 20, 5)
        self.conv2 = nn.Conv2d(20, 20, 5)

    def forward(self, x):
        x = F.relu(self.conv1(x))
        return F.relu(self.conv2(x))

Submodules assigned in this way will be registered, and will also have their parameters converted when you call to(), etc.

As per the example above, an __init__() call to the parent class must be made before assignment on the child.

:ivar training: Boolean represents whether this module is in training or evaluation mode. :vartype training: bool

1112                self.__cache["alibi_attention_bias"] = alibi_bias
1113            return alibi_bias
1114        context = get_autocast_context(device)
1115        with context:
1116            alibi_bias = alibi_attention_bias(seq_len, self.config, device)
1117        self.__cache["alibi_attention_bias"] = alibi_bias
1118        return alibi_bias
def forward( self, input_ids: torch.LongTensor, input_embeddings: Optional[torch.FloatTensor] = None, attention_mask: Optional[torch.Tensor] = None, attention_bias: Optional[torch.Tensor] = None, past_key_values: Optional[Sequence[Tuple[torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor]]] = None, use_cache: bool = False, last_logits_only: bool = False, output_hidden_states: Optional[bool] = None) -> LLaDAOutput: 
1120    def forward(
1121        self,
1122        input_ids: torch.LongTensor,
1123        input_embeddings: Optional[torch.FloatTensor] = None,
1124        attention_mask: Optional[torch.Tensor] = None,
1125        attention_bias: Optional[torch.Tensor] = None,
1126        past_key_values: Optional[Sequence[Tuple[torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor]]] = None,
1127        use_cache: bool = False,
1128        last_logits_only: bool = False,
1129        output_hidden_states: Optional[bool] = None,
1130    ) -> LLaDAOutput:
1131        """
1132        :param input_ids: A tensor of shape `(batch_size, seq_len)`.
1133        :param input_embeddings: A tensor of shape `(batch_size, seq_len, d_model)` with input
1134            embeddings. When provided, it is treated as the output of the input embedding layer.
1135        :param attention_mask: A tensor of shape `(batch_size, seq_len)` that indicates
1136            which input IDs are masked. A `1` value in the mask means that
1137            the corresponding input ID should *not* be ignored. A `0` means
1138            that the corresponding input ID is masked.
1139
1140            This has the same meaning as the `attention_mask` in HuggingFace's `transformers`
1141            library.
1142        :param attention_bias: A tensor of shape `(batch_size, 1, seq_len, seq_len)`,
1143            `(1, 1, seq_len, seq_len)`, or `(seq_len, seq_len)`. This is used
1144            to introduce causal or other biases.
1145
1146            If the tensor is a bool or byte tensor, a `True` or `1` at `attention_bias[:, :, i, j]`
1147            indicates that the i-th element in the sequence is allowed to attend to the j-th
1148            element in the sequence.
1149
1150            If the tensor is a float tensor, it will just be added to the attention
1151            scores before the softmax.
1152
1153            The default is causal, which corresponds to a lower-diagonal byte matrix of ones.
1154        :param past_key_values: Pre-computed keys and values for each attention block.
1155            Can be used to speed up sequential decoding. The `input_ids` which have
1156            their past given to this model should not be passed as `input_ids` as they have already been computed.
1157        :param use_cache: If `True`, return key and value tensors for each block.
1158        :param last_logits_only: If `True`, only compute the logits for the last token of each sequence.
1159            This can speed up decoding when you only care about the next token.
1160        """
1161        # Add Basic MDM Model config check
1162        assert not self.config.alibi, "Alibi length extrapolation is not supported for MDM."
1163        assert self.config.rope, "Rope must be used in Llama-Encoder for MDM."
1164        assert past_key_values is None and not use_cache, "The kvcache is not suppotred for MDM."
1165
1166        output_hidden_states = output_hidden_states if output_hidden_states is not None else False
1167
1168        if past_key_values:
1169            assert len(past_key_values) == self.config.n_layers
1170
1171        batch_size, seq_len = input_ids.size() if input_embeddings is None else input_embeddings.size()[:2]
1172        if past_key_values is None:
1173            past_length = 0
1174        else:
1175            past_length = past_key_values[0][0].size(-2)
1176
1177        # Get embeddings of input.
1178        # shape: (batch_size, seq_len, d_model)
1179        # print(f"input_ids: {input_ids}, input_ids.shape: {input_ids.shape}")
1180        # print(f"transformer wte weight shape: {self.transformer.wte.weight.shape}")
1181        x = self.transformer.wte(input_ids) if input_embeddings is None else input_embeddings  # type: ignore
1182
1183        # print(f"xshape: {x.shape}")
1184
1185        if self.config.input_emb_norm:
1186            x = x * (self.config.d_model**0.5)
1187
1188        if not (self.config.alibi or self.config.rope):
1189            # Get positional embeddings.
1190            # shape: (1, seq_len)
1191            pos = torch.arange(past_length, past_length + seq_len, dtype=torch.long, device=x.device).unsqueeze(0)
1192            # shape: (1, seq_len, d_model)
1193            pos_emb = self.transformer.wpe(pos)  # type: ignore
1194            x = pos_emb + x
1195
1196        # Add input + positional embeddings and apply dropout.
1197        # shape: (batch_size, seq_len, d_model)
1198        x = self.transformer.emb_drop(x)  # type: ignore
1199
1200        # Transform the attention mask into what the blocks expect.
1201        if attention_mask is not None and 0.0 in attention_mask:
1202            # shape: (batch_size, 1, 1, seq_len)
1203            attention_mask = attention_mask.to(dtype=torch.float).view(batch_size, -1)[:, None, None, :]
1204            attention_mask = (1.0 - attention_mask) * torch.finfo(attention_mask.dtype).min
1205        else:
1206            attention_mask = None
1207
1208        # Merge attention mask with attention bias.
1209        if (
1210            attention_bias is not None
1211            or attention_mask is not None
1212            or self.config.alibi
1213            # NOTE (epwalsh): we need to initialize the attn bias in order for attn to work properly
1214            # with key+value cache. Otherwise `F.scaled_dot_product_attention()` doesn't seem to compute
1215            # scores correctly.
1216            or past_key_values is not None
1217        ):
1218            if attention_bias is None and self.config.alibi:
1219                # print(f"get_causal_attention_bias")
1220                attention_bias = get_causal_attention_bias(self.__cache, past_length + seq_len, x.device) + self.get_alibi_attention_bias(past_length + seq_len, x.device)
1221            elif attention_bias is None:
1222                # print(f"get_causal_attention_bias")
1223                attention_bias = get_causal_attention_bias(self.__cache, past_length + seq_len, x.device)
1224            elif attention_bias.dtype in (torch.int8, torch.bool):
1225                # print(f"attention_bias.dtype in (torch.int8, torch.bool)")
1226                attention_bias = attention_bias.to(dtype=torch.float)
1227                attention_bias.masked_fill_(attention_bias == 0.0, torch.finfo(attention_bias.dtype).min)
1228
1229            # Transform to the right shape and data type.
1230            mask_len = seq_len
1231            if attention_mask is not None:
1232                mask_len = attention_mask.shape[-1]
1233            elif past_key_values is not None:
1234                mask_len = past_key_values[0][0].shape[-2] + seq_len
1235            attention_bias = attention_bias[:, :, :mask_len, :mask_len].to(dtype=torch.float)
1236
1237            # Add in the masking bias.
1238            if attention_mask is not None:
1239                attention_bias = attention_bias + attention_mask
1240                # Might get -infs after adding attention mask, since dtype.min + dtype.min = -inf.
1241                # `F.scaled_dot_product_attention()` doesn't handle -inf like you'd expect, instead
1242                # it can produce NaNs.
1243                ensure_finite_(attention_bias, check_neg_inf=True, check_pos_inf=False)
1244
1245        attn_key_values: Optional[List[Tuple[torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor]]] = [] if use_cache else None
1246
1247        # decoder layers
1248        all_hidden_states = []
1249
1250        # Apply blocks one-by-one.
1251        if self.config.block_group_size == 1:
1252            for block_idx, block in enumerate(self.transformer.blocks):
1253                if output_hidden_states:
1254                    # add hidden states
1255                    all_hidden_states.append(x)
1256
1257                layer_past = None if past_key_values is None else past_key_values[block_idx]
1258                if (
1259                    (self.activation_checkpointing_strategy == ActivationCheckpointingStrategy.whole_layer)
1260                    or (self.activation_checkpointing_strategy == ActivationCheckpointingStrategy.one_in_two and block_idx % 2 == 0)
1261                    or (self.activation_checkpointing_strategy == ActivationCheckpointingStrategy.one_in_three and block_idx % 3 == 0)
1262                    or (self.activation_checkpointing_strategy == ActivationCheckpointingStrategy.one_in_four and block_idx % 4 == 0)
1263                ):
1264                    # shape: (batch_size, seq_len, d_model)
1265                    x, cache = self._activation_checkpoint_fn(block, x, attention_bias=attention_bias, layer_past=layer_past, use_cache=use_cache)
1266                else:
1267                    # shape: (batch_size, seq_len, d_model)
1268                    x, cache = block(x, attention_bias=attention_bias, layer_past=layer_past, use_cache=use_cache)
1269                if attn_key_values is not None:
1270                    assert cache is not None
1271                    attn_key_values.append(cache)
1272        else:
1273            for group_idx, block_group in enumerate(self.transformer.block_groups):
1274                if output_hidden_states:
1275                    # add hidden states
1276                    all_hidden_states.append(x)
1277
1278                layers_past = None if past_key_values is None else past_key_values[group_idx * self.config.block_group_size : (group_idx + 1) * self.config.block_group_size]
1279                x, cache = block_group(x, attention_bias=attention_bias, layers_past=layers_past, use_cache=use_cache)
1280                if attn_key_values is not None:
1281                    assert cache is not None
1282                    attn_key_values.extend(cache)
1283
1284        if last_logits_only:
1285            # shape: (batch_size, 1, d_model)
1286            x = x[:, -1, :].unsqueeze(1)
1287
1288        # Apply final layer norm.
1289        # shape: (batch_size, seq_len or 1, d_model)
1290        x = self.transformer.ln_f(x)  # type: ignore
1291        if output_hidden_states:
1292            # add final hidden state post-final-layernorm, following HuggingFace's convention
1293            all_hidden_states.append(x)
1294
1295        # Get logits.
1296        # shape: (batch_size, seq_len or 1, vocab_size)
1297        if self.config.weight_tying:
1298            logits = F.linear(x, self.transformer.wte.weight, None)  # type: ignore
1299        else:
1300            logits = self.transformer.ff_out(x)  # type: ignore
1301        if self.config.scale_logits:
1302            logits.mul_(1 / math.sqrt(self.config.d_model))
1303
1304        return LLaDAOutput(logits=logits, attn_key_values=attn_key_values, hidden_states=tuple(all_hidden_states) if output_hidden_states else None)  # type: ignore[arg-type]
Parameters
  • input_ids: A tensor of shape (batch_size, seq_len).
  • input_embeddings: A tensor of shape (batch_size, seq_len, d_model) with input embeddings. When provided, it is treated as the output of the input embedding layer.

  • attention_mask: A tensor of shape (batch_size, seq_len) that indicates which input IDs are masked. A 1 value in the mask means that the corresponding input ID should not be ignored. A 0 means that the corresponding input ID is masked.

    This has the same meaning as the attention_mask in HuggingFace's transformers library.

  • attention_bias: A tensor of shape (batch_size, 1, seq_len, seq_len), (1, 1, seq_len, seq_len), or (seq_len, seq_len). This is used to introduce causal or other biases.

    If the tensor is a bool or byte tensor, a True or 1 at attention_bias[:, :, i, j] indicates that the i-th element in the sequence is allowed to attend to the j-th element in the sequence.

    If the tensor is a float tensor, it will just be added to the attention scores before the softmax.

    The default is causal, which corresponds to a lower-diagonal byte matrix of ones.

  • past_key_values: Pre-computed keys and values for each attention block. Can be used to speed up sequential decoding. The input_ids which have their past given to this model should not be passed as input_ids as they have already been computed.
  • use_cache: If True, return key and value tensors for each block.
  • last_logits_only: If True, only compute the logits for the last token of each sequence. This can speed up decoding when you only care about the next token.
